camelup.camelup module¶

Main module.

class camelup.camelup.Game(num_players)[source]¶

Bases: object

base class - doesn’t initalize anything

available_moves()[source]¶

Computes all the moves that are available.

Returns

Moves available to play

Return type

list

available_moves_pruned()[source]¶

Computes all the moves that are available, pruned for only moves that make sense.

Can only bet on the top 2 and bottom the camels for the game. Can’t place tiles that go past the farthest camel by 3 spaces. Can only bet on the top 3 camels for the turn

Returns

Moves available to play

Return type

list

available_tile_placements()[source]¶

Compute the available tiles

Returns

List of available spaces of tiles

Return type

list

available_tile_placements_pruned()[source]¶

Compute the available tiles

Returns

List of available spaces of tiles

Return type

list

end_game()[source]¶

Ends the game 1. Scores the round 2. Scores the winner bets 3. Scores the loser bets

end_round()[source]¶

The end of the round triggers the following 1. Scores the tiles 2. Resets the camels need_roll flag 3. Returns the skip/block tile to the players hand 4. Removes the bet tiles from the players hand 5. Place the bet tiles back on the board

game_monte(camel_dict, tiles_dict, iter=1000)[source]¶

Runs monte carlo for the turn

play(move)[source]¶

  1. Plays the move

  2. Update state

Parameters

move ('str') – The move to play, formatted as a function

play_bet_tile(camel)[source]¶

Play a bet tile

Parameters

camel (str) – The camel to take a bet tile for

play_loser_card(camel)[source]¶

Play a loser card

Parameters

camel (str) – The camel to bet on a loss

play_roll(camel, roll)[source]¶

  1. Moves the camel

  2. Give points if camel landed on a block or skip tile

  3. Gives a point to the roller

  4. Updates needs roll

  5. Checks for end of game

  6. Checks for end of round

Parameters

  • camel (str) – Camel that is rolled

  • roll (int) – The number that is rolled

play_tile(tile_type, space)[source]¶

Plays a skip or block tile

Parameters

  • tile_type (str) – Type of tyle, either block or skip

  • space (int) – The space to play the tile

play_winner_card(camel)[source]¶

Play a winner card

Parameters

camel (str) – The camel to bet on a win

score_round()[source]¶

Scores the round based on the tiles the players have and the position of camels. If the camel is in first then the player gets full points. If in second they get 1 point, else they lose a point

sim_game(camel_dict, tiles)[source]¶

Simulates a single game

sim_turn(camel_dict, tiles)[source]¶

Simulates a single turn

turn_monte(camel_dict, tiles_dict, iter=1000)[source]¶

Runs monte carlo for the turn

camelup.config module¶

camelup.gameplay module¶

Module with basic gameplay

camelup.gameplay.block_move(camel_dict, movers, destinationers, destination, min_height_movers, num_movers)[source]¶

Executing a move where the camel hit a block tile

Parameters

  • camel_dict (nested dict) – Dictionary with current camel positions

  • movers (list) – List of camels that are moving

  • destinationers (list) – List of camels on the destination square

  • destination (int) – Square where camels are moving

  • min_height_movers (int) – The minimum height of the camels that are moving

  • num_movers (int) – The number of camels moving

camelup.gameplay.camels_in_dest(camel_dict, destination)[source]¶

Find the camels in the destination square

Parameters

  • camel_dict (nested dict) – Dictionary with current camel positions

  • destination (int) – Square where camels are moving

Returns

  • max_height_dest (int) – The max height of camels on the destination sqaure

  • destinationers (list) – List of camels on the destination square

camelup.gameplay.camels_to_move(camel_dict, space, height)[source]¶

Getting information about camels that need to move

Parameters

  • camel_dict (nested dict) – Dictionary with current camel positions

  • space (int) – Space the camel is on

  • height (int) – Height of the camel

Returns

  • min_height_movers (int) – The minimum height of the camels that are moving

  • num_movers (int) – The number of camels moving

  • movers (list) – List of camels that are moving

camelup.gameplay.move(camel_dict, tiles_dict, camel, roll)[source]¶

Puting all the moves together

Parameters

  • camel_dict (nested dict) – Dictionary with current camel positions

  • tiles_dict (dict) – Dictonary with tiles information

  • camel (str) – Name of camel that was rolled

  • roll (int) – Roll on dice, ranges from 1 to 3

Returns

give_points – The tile which was landed on and thusly should give points

Return type

int

  • destination (int) – Square where camels are moving

  • min_height_movers (int) – The minimum height of the camels that are moving

  • max_height_dest (int) – The max height of camels on the destination sqaure

camelup.treesearch.exp_value(game, depth, MAX_DEPTH)[source]¶

Calculate the expected value from a roll play

Parameters

  • game (camel up game) – Camel up game class

  • depth (int) – The current depth in the tree

  • MAX_DEPTH (int) – Depth of tree to be built, 1 is recommended for performance considerations

Returns

Utilities of the expected value of the play

Return type

list

Recommends the most optimal move

  • game (camel up game) – Camel up game class

  • MAX_DEPTH (int) – Depth of tree to be built, 1 is recommended for performance considerations

dict

Parameters

  • depth (int) – The current depth in the tree

  • MAX_DEPTH (int) – Depth of tree to be built, 1 is recommended for performance considerations

list

camelup.treesearch.value(game, move, depth, player, MAX_DEPTH)[source]¶

Value function for recursive multi agent utility

Parameters

  • game (camel up game) – Camel up game class

  • move (str) – The move that is being assessed for value

  • depth (int) – The current depth in the tree

  • player (int) – The current player in the tree

  • MAX_DEPTH (int) – Depth of tree to be built, 1 is recommended for performance considerations

Returns

The value of the move for all players

Return type

list
